projects.title: Trivial File Transfer Protocol
projects.desc: This Java program is a TFTP implementation that acts similar to a TCP handshake, which allows packets to be sent from one computer to another. Acknowledgement packets ensures that eachpacket was sent successfully

projects.title: Email Signature
projects.desc: A client from Upwork requested an email signature and provided assets and a general layout. I sent prototypes of the signature to the client and made changes accordingly

projects.title: Message Board
projects.desc: A full stack (MERN) site using Express/Node to create a REST API in order to communicate with the MongoDB           database. This allows users to register, create new messages, and view other people's messages. It's currently a local host project and a minimum viable product.

projects.title: Project Management System
projects.desc: This Spring project relies heavily on mocking agile development to mimic what working on projects would be like. I created features on new branches and pull requests were required to add to the production branch.  Every new feature required unit tests as a bare minimum. I conducted  biweekly stand-ups to view the project's status and to consider future features

projects.title: JavaScript Calculator
projects.desc: I created a calculator using JavaScript to manipulate the DOM which consisted of adding the many buttons and their repective event listeners. I also performed the calculations using closures in order to allow for chaining and styling was done with CSS.
